item.title: Z-nucleic-acid sensing triggers ZBP1-dependent necroptosis and inflammation
item.description: Title Z-nucleic-acid sensing triggers ZBP1-dependent necroptosis and inflammation Citation Jiao, H., Wachsmuth, L., Kumari, S. et al. Z-nucleic-acid sensing triggers ZBP1-dependent necroptosis and inflammation. Nature (2020).https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-020-2129-8 Abtract The biological function of Z-DNA and Z-RNA, nucleic acid structures with a left-handed double helix, is poorly understood1,2,3. Z-DNA-binding protein 1 (ZBP1; also known as DAI or DLM-1) is a nucleic acid sensor that contains two Zα domains that bind Z-DNA4,5 and Z-RNA6,7,8.
